title: 99 Froggs Community of Experts
description: 99 Froggs is a platform to manage organizations, members, projects, and events. Developed using some stacks such as Vue.js, Nuxt.Js, HTML, CSS, Tailwind, Nest.Js, MySQL, Docker, etc.

title: Just2bfit Manager System
description: Just2bfit Manager is an application designed to oversee Just2bfit's content, including statistical dashboards, newsletter management, organization management, and more. It was built using Node.js, Express.js, MySQL, Redis, Nuxt.js, Docker, and other technologies.

title: Just2bfit Content Management System
description: The Content Management System (CMS) is a management tool for Just2bfit's content, such as posts, pages, videos, recipes, and more. It supports multiple languages and regions, it was created using Node.js, Express.js, MySQL, Redis, Nuxt.js, and Docker.

title: Just2bfit BYV
description: Just2bfit BYV are web and mobile platforms designed to distribute content to members worldwide, tailored by region and language.

title: Working Time Registration
description: Working Time Registration is an application that aims to manage employee working hours at the hemlock company in the Netherlands. The features of this application consist of recording working hours, leave, recapitulation, etc.

title: Production Import
description: The internal application to processes, calculates, and manages production data. It is developed using technologies such as Node.js, Express.js, MySQL, Vue.js, Nuxt.js, and others.

title: Just2bfit Data Warehouse
description: Just2bfit Data Warehouse is a back-end service to store and provide the data that is displayed on the dashboard. Developed using serverless computing frameworks by Google Cloud Functions.

title: Just2bfit Cache Manager
description: Just2bfit Cache Manager is a back-end service to cache all of Just2bfit CMS data and distribute it to multiple regions worldwide.

title: Kwify
description: Kiwify is a platform for selling online courses, allowing anyone to register to sell or purchase courses. In this project, I was responsible for developing several backend parts using Node.js, MySQL, and other technologies.

title: Satu Data
description: Satu Data is a platform by the Aceh Provincial Government for managing data from all regencies and departments before it is published to Open Data. This is dynamic application allows administrators to create forms dynamically. Satu data also integrated with several services, such as CKAN Open Data and Singgle Sign On, On this project i have been worked independently and deliver high-quality work. It was developed using Javascript, Node.js, React.js, Next.js, HTML, CSS, MySQL, Redis, Docker, and other technologies.

title: HABA
description: The government application serves as a hub for information on government affairs, tourism, health, natural disasters, security, and transportation.

title: PPID
description: The Information and Documentation Management Officer (PPID) is an officer responsible for the storage, documentation, and/or service of information in public bodies.

title: PPID Multiple Sites
description: A part of The Information and Documentation Management Officer (PPID) to manage multiple websites and domains for 23 different regencies, with each regency having its own unique domain and customized UI/UX.

title: PPID Integrated with Esign BSrE BSSN
description: Integrating the PPID system with the national Esign BSrE BSSN system, where every documents published by PPID can be digitally signed. This integration was carried out using a RESTful API.

title: DALAE
description: A system designed to aggregate news and articles from government websites in Aceh and will be utilized to generate reports and graphs based on the collected data.

title: HOAX DB
description: It is an aggregator system designed to collect information on hoaxes and misinformation from various sources. Citizens can also submit suspected information, which the government will then investigate and release the results.

title: Digital Library
description: A digital library to manage all collections, library circulation and reporting in university. Developed using PHP, MySQL, Bootstrap, etc

title: Academic Information System
description: The application is designed to manage the entire study process from beginning to end.

title: The Vaccination Registration Information System
description: The vaccination registration information system was designed to simplify the process for citizens in Aceh province to register for Covid-19 vaccinations. Used by tens of thousands during the pandemic, it offers features for both public users and administrators, including registration, printing registration numbers, a statistics dashboard, quota management, user management, etc.

title: LKH Dai (Cleric Daily Reporting)
description: The application used by clerics to submit daily activity reports allows them to do so via a mobile app. Government department administrators then verify these reports and generate a summary.

title: SIMTANAH (Geographic Information System)
description: An application for collecting and managing spatial data in the Aceh province area, used by the land department of the Aceh government. It is built using technologies such as Node.js, Express.js, React.js, Leaflet, MongoDB, and others.

title: Electronic Theses and Dissertation
description: A hight performance application designed to manage digital files of theses and dissertations, utilized by tens of thousands of students, lecturers, and researchers. Students are required to upload their theses or dissertations after their final exams.

title: USK Integrated Library System (UILIS)
description: UILIS is an information system designed to integrate library services at USK University. The library offers a variety of services, including electronic theses, an online catalog, electronic journals, eBooks, reporting, and more.

title: USK Union Catalogue
description: The aim is to make it easier to search catalogs in each library at Syiah Kuala University.

title: Open Educational Resources
description: OER, or Open Educational Resources, aims to simplify the process for students, lecturers, and other academics to find the open resources they need. Librarians actively collecting these open resources and store them in the OER collection.
